results.headline: Review: ‘T2 Trainspotting’: Time to Pay the Piper
results.summary_short: The sequel to the gloriously scabrous film that kick-started the careers of Danny Boyle and Ewan McGregor illustrates the consequences of a misspent youth.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of T2 Trainspotting

results.headline: Review: Fiction and Nonfiction Blur in ‘Actor Martinez’
results.summary_short: Acting may be his first love, but the title character in “Actor Martinez” soon learns it’s no picnic — especially when dealing with his directors.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Actor Martinez

results.headline: Review: In ‘Atomica,’ Hunting for Clues in a Nuclear Waste Zone
results.summary_short: This sci-fi thriller may not have “Arrival”-level effects or sophistication, but it delivers a solid B-movie kick.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Atomica

results.headline: Review: ‘Betting on Zero’ Tracks a Crusade Against Herbalife
results.summary_short: A documentary looks at a hedge fund manager’s $1 billion bet against that nutritional company and his efforts to expose what he characterized as consumer fraud.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Betting on Zero

results.headline: Review: ‘Mean Dreams’ Presents Lovers on the Lam With Quiet Skill
results.summary_short: Nathan Morlando’s film may focus on two young lovers, but Bill Paxton shines as a corrupt sheriff in one of his final film roles.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Mean Dreams

results.headline: Review: A Provocateur’s Recounting in ‘The Show About the Show’
results.summary_short: Caveh Zahedi, the film’s director and star, recounts the misadventures experienced while producing an initially sexually explicit semidocumentary series.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Show About the Show

results.headline: Review: ‘Tickling Giants’ Made It in Egypt, but They Weren’t Laughing
results.summary_short: Bassem Youssef and the Egyptian satirical program he hosted after the Arab Spring is the focus of this documentary.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Tickling Giants

results.headline: Review: Intimate Struggles Come to Life in ‘After the Storm’
results.summary_short: The Japanese director Hirokazu Kore-eda’s latest family drama, focusing on a writer who’s fallen on hard times, works in a quiet cinematic register.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of After the Storm

results.headline: Review: ‘The Belko Experiment’: Kill or Be Killed
results.summary_short: This film, set in Colombia, wallows in the cheap and hackneyed irony of choreographed slaughter.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Belko Experiment

results.headline: Review: Malevolent Energy in the Form of ‘The Devil’s Candy’
results.summary_short: Profoundly irritating adult behavior aside, Sean Byrne’s enjoyable horror film looks great and benefits from a grungy palette and game performers.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Devil's Candy

results.headline: Review: ‘Frantz,’ a Mysterious Frenchman and the Wounds of War
results.summary_short: François Ozon’s adaptation of Ernst Lubitsch’s 1932 antiwar film, “Broken Lullaby,” is set in Germany and France in the aftermath of World War I.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Frantz

results.headline: Review: In ‘Badrinath Ki Dulhania,’ Boy Meets Girl (and Learns to Respect Her)
results.summary_short: This Bollywood rom-com, directed by Shashank Khaitan, describes the growing pains of a gentleman whose fiancée teaches him to acknowledge her equality.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Badrinath Ki Dulhania

results.headline: Review: Give a Student Some Offal, and You’ll Regret It in ‘Raw’
results.summary_short: Julia Ducournau’s film unfolds during rush week in a nightmarish veterinary school.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Raw

results.headline: Review: Kristen Stewart Is Entrancing as a Haunted ‘Personal Shopper’
results.summary_short: Olivier Assayas’s new film is both a supernatural thriller and an unnerving inquiry into the drift and mystery of modern life.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Personal Shopper

results.headline: Review: In ‘Brimstone,’ the B Is for Bleak, Brutal and Bloody
results.summary_short: This western from the Dutch writer and director Martin Koolhoven puts Dakota Fanning and Guy Pearce through a gantlet of gore and gunplay.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Brimstone

results.headline: Review: In ‘Canners,’ One Man’s Trash Is Another’s Nickel Treasure
results.summary_short: A documentary follows bottle and can collectors in New York as they toil to fill their carts for $30 or $40 a day.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Canners

results.headline: Review: In ‘This Beautiful Fantastic,’ a Gardener Blooms
results.summary_short: A young woman who can’t tame her yard meets her match and savior in a crotchety old neighbor.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of This Beautiful Fantastic

results.headline: Review: A Combustible Pair Find Love in ‘The Other Half’
results.summary_short: This moody romance stars Tatiana Maslany (“Orphan Black”) as a bipolar painter in love with a brooding cabby (Tom Cullen of “Downton Abbey”).

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Other Half

results.headline: Review: Love as the World Wars, in ‘The Ottoman Lieutenant’
results.summary_short: A nurse travels to the Ottoman Empire on the eve of World War I. Can romance blossom amid earthshaking events?

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Ottoman Lieutenant

results.headline: Review: The Soundtrack Is the Star of ‘Who’s Crazy?’
results.summary_short: Featuring Ornette Coleman and Marianne Faithfull, the music provides counterpoint to a tale of patients from a psychiatric institution on a kind of holiday.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Who's Crazy?
